metadata.title: CVE-2017-5838 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The gst_date_time_new_from_iso8601_string function in gst/gstdatetime.c inGStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds heap read) via a malformed datetime string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gstreamer-1.0 - 1.8.3-1~ubuntu0.1+esm1
gstreamer1.0-tools - 1.8.3-1~ubuntu0.1+esm1
libgstreamer1.0-0 - 1.8.3-1~ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gstreamer0.10 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
gstreamer1.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-1~ubuntu0.1+esm1').
